label.description: 1. What Ministry Are You Reporting For?
2. Does the ministry have a Ministry BCM Advisor?
3. Is Business Continuity Management Program (BCMP) discussed at the executive level?
4. Does the BCM program have an executive sponsor?
5. Has the ministry implemented a Business Continuity Management Program policy or strategic plan?
6. Upload Plan
7. Does the ministry BCM program have a steering committee?
8. Leadership Comments
Business Continuity Management Program Awareness
9. Has the Ministry Business Continuity Advisor received training from a Business Continuity Management Program certification body?
10. Is there an established network of plan owners and/or coordinators?
11. Are ministry executive aware of the BCM Program?
12. Are Business Continuity team members aware of their roles?
13. Is there an annual Business Continuity Management Program campaign to promote all staff awareness?
New Section
14. Awareness Comments
Critical Services
Critical Services
15. How many Business Impact Analyses (BIAs) does your ministry require?
16. How many Business Impact Analyses were reviewed and updated in 2025?
17. How many Business Impacts Analyses (BIAs) were approved or signed by required leadership?
18. Does the ministry have an up to date list of their critical services?
19. Are critical services annually reviewed and signed off by Ministry Executive?
20. Are critical service recovery strategies annually reviewed and signed off by Ministry Executive?
New Section
21. Critical Services Comments
Business Continuity Plan
22. Does the BCP include notification and activation procedures?
23. Does the BCP include cold or warm site set up procedures?
Site Temp Procedure Description
24. Does the BCP contain manual procedures?
25. Does the BCP contain instructions for recreating lost data?

26. Has the ministry conducted a full-scale Business Continuity Plan (BCP) recovery exercise, integrating notification, activation, manual processes, and IT recovery, with documented lessons learned and improvements made?
New Section
27. BCP Comments
Recovery Strategies
31. Do BCP Recovery Team members have an alternate?
28. What methods of communication will be used after a disaster?
29. Does the alternate site have essential infrastructure to maintain operations?
If you answered Other to question 29, please provide description
30. Have the records and data required to support recovery been backed up to a source that is accessible if the network is unavailable?

32. Are IT Disaster Recovery (ITDR) plans in place for the ministry systems identified as critical, and do the Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) of ministry critical systems align with the RTOs of the critical services dependent on them?
If you answered Other to question 32, please provide description
33. Recovery Strategies Comments
Business Continuity Training
34. Have coordinators and plan owners received Business Impact Analysis (BIA) training?
35. Have plan owners and coordinators received training on identifying and selecting recovery strategies?
36. Have plan owners and coordinators received training on writing recovery procedures?
37. Have Coordinators received training on exercise design and delivery?
38. Have Business Continuity Coordinators and Plan Owners received the necessary training in Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Recovery Strategies, Recovery Procedures, and Exercise Design?
New Section
39. Business Continuity Training Comments
Business Continuity Exercises
40. How many Business Continuity Plans (BCPs) does your ministry have?
41. How many Business Continuity Plan orientations occurred in 2025?
42. How many Business Continuity Plan drills were conducted in 2025?
43. How many Business Continuity Plan tabletop exercises were conducted in 2025?
44. How many Business Continuity Plan functional exercises were conducted in 2025?
45. How many Business Continuity Plan full scale exercises were conducted in 2025?
New Section
46. Business Continuity Exercises Comments
Crisis Management
Crisis Management
47. Has the MOC Plan been annually reviewed and/or updated?
48. Does the MOC Director have an alternate?
49. Does the MOC alternate site have essential infrastructure, including setup procedures, power, water, internet, and connectivity solutions, to support operations?
50. Does the MOC have a Crisis Communication Plan?
51. Does the MOC have a plan for addressing staffing issues?
New Section
52. Crisis Management Comments
MOC Training
Ministry Operations Centre Training
53. Is an MOC overview available to staff?
54. Has ICS 100 been offered to BCM/MOC staff?
55. Is training on the MOC alternate site available to staff?
56. Have MOC staff been trained on their positions and processes?
57. Have MOC Leadership (MOC Director and Alternates) been trained?
New Section
58. MOC Training Comments
MOC Exercises
Ministry Operations Centre Exercises
59. Has an MOC orientation been provided to MOC staff?
60. Has an MOC Communications Drill been conducted?
61. Has an MOC Tabletop Exercise been conducted?
62. Has a Functional MOC Exercise occurred?
63. Has the MOC participated in a full-scale or cross government exercise?
New Section
64. MOC Exercises Comments
Supply Chain Management
65. Have critical dependencies been identified?
66. Have critical dependencies been prioritized based on risk?
67. Are strategies in place for the loss of critical vendors and partners?
68. Do critical vendors participate in an annual plan review or assessment?
69. Has the ministry conducted a full-scale resilience test of critical dependencies, including vendors, partners, and supply chains, with documented improvements?
New Section
70. Supply Chain Management Comments
Is Survey Completed?
71. Has your ministry executive approved the survey results?
